summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Barrett Street, from Fifteenth Avenue West to Seventeenth Avenue West, all in the City of Seattle, by constructing concrete walks thereon, together with necessary curbs, gutters, cross walks, and other necessary appurtenances, in accordance with Resolution No. 318 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
